convention.faviconHelpText: Used by browsers for the icon in tabs for this site.  180x180 pixels is recommended.

convention.openGraphImageHelpText: Used by social media sites for previewing links to this site. 1200x630 pixels is recommended for Facebook.
convention.signupScheduleMoved: The signup schedule editor has moved! To edit the signup schedule for this convention, go to the Admin menu and choose “Signup rounds.”
convention.stripeAccountActive: {{ conventionName }} is connected to a Stripe account and is able to sell {{ ticketNamePlural }} and/or products.
convention.stripeAccountContinue: Continue Stripe account setup for {{ conventionName }}
convention.stripeAccountPending: {{ conventionName }} is connected to a Stripe account but that account is still in the setup process.
convention.stripeAccountRequired: In order to sell {{ ticketNamePlural }} and/or products, a Stripe account is required.

eventCategories.autogenerateColorsLabel: Generate signed up and full colors based on default color
eventCategories.cannotDeleteCategoryWithEvents: This event category cannot be deleted because there are events in it. To delete it, first either drop these events or change their categories.
eventCategories.deleteConfirmation: Are you sure you want to delete this event category?
eventCategories.eventProposalFormLabel: Event proposal form (optional; if blank this event category cannot be proposed)
eventCategories.proposalDescriptionHelpText:
When attendees propose an event and select this category, the proposal dialog will show
          the text you write here.  Use this to describe what they can expect after proposing the
          event.  For example: ”Your proposal will go to the Board Game Proposals Committee.  You‘ll
          hear back within a week or two.“
eventCategories.teamMemberNameHelpText: This is the word the site will use to refer to team members of this event, e.g. “GM”, “facilitator”, etc.

events.dropEventConfirmation: Are you sure you want to drop this event?

rooms.deleteConfirmation: Are you sure you want to delete this room?

orderEntries.deleteConfirmation_one: Are you sure you want to delete {{ count }} {{ productName }} item from the order?  This cannot be undone.
orderEntries.deleteConfirmation_other: Are you sure you want to delete {{ count }} {{ productName }} items from the order?  This cannot be undone.
orderEntries.deleteCouponConfirmation: Are you sure you want to delete this coupon from the order?  This cannot be undone.

products.deleteConfirmation: Are you sure you want to delete the product {{ productName }}?

ticketTypes.eventProvidedDescription_one: events can provide up to {{ count }} {{ ticketName }}
ticketTypes.eventProvidedDescription_other: events can provide up to {{ count }} {{ ticketName }}

addAttendee.dataCopyingNote: Profile data will be copied from user’s latest convention profile.
addAttendee.text: Choose a user to add as an attendee for {{ conventionName }}.  This person must already be a user in the site database in order to be added.

signupsCard.unSignedUpOther: {{ name }} is a team member for the following events, but is not signed up for them:
signupsCard.unSignedUpYou: You are a team member for the following events, but are not signed up for them:
signupsCard.withdrawFromAllConfirmation: Are you sure you want to withdraw {{ name }} from all their events at {{ conventionName }}?

warnings.emptyUserConProfileForm: <0>This convention has no user profile form set up, or the form is empty.</0><1>To create or edit the user profile form, go here.</1><2></2><3>To set it as the user profile form for this convention, go here.</3>

editUser.currentPasswordHelpText: We need your current password to verify your identity
editUser.passwordHelpText: Leave blank if you don’t want to change it

forgotPasswordForm.successMessage: <0>Please check your email.  You should receive instructions on how to reset your password shortly.</0><1>If you don’t receive instructions, please email <2>our web team</2> for help resetting your password.</1>

authentication.logInLink: Log in to an existing account

userForm.nameWarning: Please note that each convention keeps a separate record of your name.  Changing your name here will apply to new conventions you sign up for in the future.  To change your name on existing conventions, please go to each convention’s web site and choose “my profile” from the menu.

buttons.proposeEventLoggedOut: Log in to propose an event

clickwrap.disclosureMessage: In order to use the {{ conventionName }} web site, you must agree to the following terms of service.  If you do not agree, please close this browser window.

layoutForm.navbarClassesHelpText: Overrides the default CSS classes for the Bootstrap navigation bar (by default, <2>{{ defaultClasses }}</2>)

cookieConsent.text: This web site uses cookies to enhance the user experience.  For more information, please see <2>our cookie policy</2>.

dateTimeFormats.longWeekdayDateTimeWithZone: cccc, MMMM d, yyyy 'at' h:mmaaa ZZZZ
dateTimeFormats.shortWeekdayDateTimeWithZone: ccc, MMM d, yyyy h:mmaaa ZZZZ

errors.404: <0>Oops!</0><1>We couldn’t find a page at the location {{pathname}}.</1>
errors.unauthorized: Sorry, your account is not authorized to view this page.

edit.deleteConfirmation: Are you sure?  This will erase your proposal along with everything you’ve written here.

newProposalModal.categoryLabel: What category of event would you like to propose?
newProposalModal.cloneFromDifferentCategoryWarning: You are proposing a {{ newCategoryName }}, but copying information from {{ cloneProposalTitle }}, which is a {{ cloneProposalCategoryName }}.  Make sure this is what you want before continuing.  You will not be able to change the category of your new event once you have started the proposal.
newProposalModal.cloneProposalLabel: If you'd like to propose an event you've proposed sometime in the past, please select it here to have its information copied into the proposal form.  Otherwise, leave this field blank.
newProposalModal.subcategoryLabel: What subcategory of {{ departmentName }} event would you like to propose?
newProposalModal.title: New event proposal

edit.dropPrompt: Are you sure you want to drop {{ eventTitle }}?  Doing so will also delete any runs of this event and remove any participants signed up for those runs.

ratings.helpText: You can mark an event as a “favorite” by clicking the <1></1> icon on it, and you can hide an event from your default view by clicking the <4></4> icon. To revert to “TBD,” click the icon again. Your preferences are always private, and event runners and convention staff cannot see what you’ve favorited or hidden.

registrationPolicies.noPreferenceDisabled: “No preference” option will not be available
registrationPolicies.noPreferenceHelpText: For events that have more than one registration bucket with limited slots, we can display a “no preference” option for signups. Users who sign up using that option will be placed in whatever limited-slot bucket has availability, and moved between buckets to make space as necessary.
registrationPolicies.noPreferenceInapplicableHelpText: This event doesn’t have more than one registration bucket with limited slots, so that option doesn’t apply.

signupAdmin.changeBucketInputCaption: Please choose a signup bucket for {{ name }}.
signupAdmin.emailsSemicolonWarning: <0>Note:</0> Most email apps use comma-separated address lists.  Only Outlook uses semicolon-separated address lists.  If you’re not using Outlook, try comma-separated first.

forceConfirmSignup.bucketInputCaption: Please choose a signup bucket for {{ name }}.
forceConfirmSignup.overfillWarning: Caution: this operation ignores registration bucket capacity (and therefore can overfill the event run). Doing this may have unexpected effects if other attendees drop out of the event. Adjusting the event capacity after doing this is strongly recommended.

signupAdmin.makeCountedConfirmPrompt: <0>Are you sure? This will make {{ name }}’s signup count towards attendee totals for {{ eventTitle }}. {{ eventTitle }} will also count towards {{ name }}’s signup limit if there is a signup cap in place.</0><1>Caution: this operation does not check whether the signup buckets are already full, and therefore may result in overfilling a bucket.</1>
signupAdmin.makeNotCountedConfirmPrompt: <0>Are you sure? This will make {{ name }}’s signup not count towards attendee totals for {{ eventTitle }}. It will also allow {{ name }} to sign up for an additional event if there is a signup cap in place.</0><1>Caution: this operation will pull additional attendees into the space freed up by making this signup not count.</1>
signupAdmin.title: Signups

teamMemberAdmin.eventProvidedTicketDescription: {{ name }} has a {{ ticketType }} {{ ticketName }} provided by {{ eventTitle }}.

receiveSignupEmail.nonWaitlistSignups: Yes, except joining and dropping from waitlist

teamMemberAdmin.receiveSignupEmailLabel: Receive email on signup and withdrawal
teamMemberAdmin.removeTeamMemberPrompt: Are you sure you want to remove {{ name }} as a {{ teamMemberName }}?

showEmail.helpPopover: Selecting this option will make the individual email address for this {{ teamMemberName }} appear on the event page, but only for logged-in site users.
showEmail.label: Show individual email address on event page

teamMemberAdmin.ticketProvidability_other: {{ eventTitle }} has {{ count }} {{ ticketName }} remaining to provide.

ageRestrictions.minimumAgeDescription_other: Must be {{ count }} years or older.
ageRestrictions.minimumAgeHelpText: If specified, the signups list will warn you if someone too young to play has signed up. <2>The site does not enforce age restrictions; you must do so yourself.</2>

mySignupQueue.addAdditional: To add more events to your queue, go to <1>the event catalog</1> or <4>the event schedule</4>. You can add events to your queue from each event’s page.

allowWaitlist.caption: What should we do if all your choices are full?

allowWaitlist.yes: Add me to the waitlist of my top-ranked choice

mySignupQueue.emptyState: You currently have no events in your signup queue. To add something to your queue, go to <2>the event catalog</2> or <5>the event schedule</5>. You can add events to your queue from each event’s page.

nextRoundAction.limited_one: At that time, players will be automatically signed up for up to {{ count }} event(s).
nextRoundAction.limited_other: At that time, players will be automatically signed up for up to {{ count }} event(s).
nextRoundAction.unlimited: At that time, players will be signed up for events automatically based on their queue selections until their schedule is full.

mySignupQueue.nextRoundInfo: The next signup round starts at <2>{{nextRoundStart}}</2>. {{nextRoundActionDescription}}
mySignupQueue.removeConfirmPrompt: Are you sure you want to remove {{ eventTitle }} from your signup queue?

ticketStatus.noTicket: You do not have a {{ ticketName }}.  You will not be able to sign up for games until you have purchased a {{ ticketName }}.
ticketStatus.ok: You have a {{ ticketName }} and will be signed up for events at that time.
ticketStatus.signupsNotAllowed: You have a {{ ticketName }} that does not allow event signups.  You will not be able to sign up for games until you have arranged for a full {{ ticketName }}.
